result.execSummary:
The defendant Erin M Roy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber is granted for treatment for defendant and any treatment required by HSD. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription. Random UA's are authorized.

AMENDED 10-05-2015: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE A FURLOUGH THURSDAY, OCTOBER 8, 2015 IN ORDER TO RENEW HER INSURANCE. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE HUBER FOR COUNSELING WITH HER CHILDREN. ALL DATES, TIMES AND LOCATIONS MUST BE VERIFIED.

AMENDED 12-08-2015; DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND MEETINGS AT THE GROVE CLUB, 1037 GROVE AVENUE, RACINE, WI 53403 ON MONDAY, WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY FROM 10:00 AM TO 11:00 AM AND MAY BE GRANTED TRAVEL TIME.

Defendant Erin M Roy in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Erin M Roy in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-16-2015/tk
Defense is asking for the Court to authorize a furlough to allow deft to reinstate her insurance as she needs insurance in order to participate in the counseling sessions that have been authorized by the Court. In the alternative, Ms. Anderson is asking for huber for work release to allow deft to obtain employment for the remainder of her sentence. The State objects to the request of the defense - argument put on the record.

BTC: If deft abuses this privlege in any fashion, deft will not like what happens in front of this Court. Furlough is granted to allow defendant to go Thursday, October 8, 2015 to reinstate her insurance. JOC may be modified to allow huber for counseling with her children.

from Defendant.
Michelle Anderson

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with co-defendant or his family. No contact with 1605 Wisconsin St.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken and to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours: Monday though Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Erin M Roy in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Erin M Roy in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Transcript filed 10-1-2015/lkh.
In 15CF606, defense waives reading of complaint and asks for PH. Defense waives time limits and believes there is a global resolution. Defense asks for waiver of preliminary hearing on the same day of SEH. The State asks for $5,000.00 cash in both cases.

BTC: Vacate warrants. The Court finds good cause to waive time limits regarding her preliminary hearing. In 15CF606, bond to be set $5,000.00 cash with the same conditions as in 13CF1390. In 13CF1390 $5,000.00 cash. Same terms and conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
